url.label: Spreadsheet URL (required)
url.tooltip: Query data source URL of the spreadsheet that holds the data

range.label: Range
range.tooltip: Range of cells in the format A1:B10

headerRows.label: Number of Header Rows
headerRows.tooltip: Specify how many rows are header rows. These will be excluded from the data and assigned as column labels in the data table. If set to Auto, the spreadsheet will guess how many rows are header rows. Note that if all your columns are string data, the spreadsheet might have difficulty determining which rows are header rows without this parameter set to something other than Auto.

google-picker-fail: To use this spreadsheet, it first needs to be published to the web. From the Google Spreadsheet menu, select File > Publish to the web, and then click the Start Publishing button. Once done, select your file from the Google Drive link again.

refresh.label: Data Refresh Interval (seconds)
refresh.tooltip: How often to check the spreadsheet for new data

scroll-by.label: Scroll By
scroll-by.tooltip: How to scroll the data if not all of it is visible

scroll-resumes.label: Scroll Resumes (seconds)
scroll-resumes.tooltip: Number of seconds to pause after scrolling is stopped by a touch
